availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George H. Milliken (Simpson County & Circuit Clerk)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, circuit court clerk and county court clerk. Simpson County native. Married to Adelaide Buntin Milliken in 1835. Father of Mary E. Milliken, Amos Milliken, Phoebe J. Milliken, and Adelaide Milliken. Married to Senora T. Vaughn Milliken in Roane County, Tennessee, on September 28, 1847. Father of Francis M. Milliken, Eliza D. Milliken, Emma Milliken, John Milliken, and Walter Milliken. Farmer in Simpson County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Clerk of the Simpson County Court in Simpson County from 1860 to 1865. Clerk of the Simpson Circuit Court in Simpson County from 1860 to 1861. Owned six enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860.
